definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: The Apostles' Creed contains a short summary of Jesus' life.
sentences.chinese: 使徒信经中包含有耶稣一生的剪影。

sentences.english: In 2000, she studied the graduate courses at Xinjing Theological Seminary.
sentences.chinese: 2000年在信经神学院读函授研究生，肄业。

sentences.english: "Disciples" (of Christ) in early 1800's in protest of creeds.
sentences.chinese: 18世纪早期，基督门徒派反对信经。

sentences.english: The difference is that the Creed was meant to be used in worship services and was quite short.
sentences.chinese: 两者的区别是，信经用于教会崇拜，内容较短。

sentences.english: The Apostle's Creed is one such declaration of faith.
sentences.chinese: 使徒信经就是这样一种对信仰的声明。

sentences.english: A 3-part series on the persons and work of the Triune God, based upon the Apostles' Creed.
sentences.chinese: 基于使徒信经，三位一体神的位格及其分工的3系列。

definition: Holy sacrament/Christian rite (esp. Protestant)/also called 聖事|圣事 by Catholics
the Pentateuch/the five books of Moses in the Old Testament
